s.text: SAMUEL PERKINS (moving from the door to his desk) Sorry to have kept you waiting for so long.
SAMUEL PERKINS (moving from the door to his desk) Sorry to have kept you waiting for so long.

SAMUEL PERKINS (moving from the door to his desk) Sorry to have kept you waiting for so long.
SAMUEL PERKINS (laughing) Mr. Hammond hated lawyers almost as much as he hated the language we use.
All four people move closer to the TV as PERKINS turns the sound on.
When it caught sight of them, it attacked.
JOHN HAMMOND (CONT'D) Before I leave you, I'd like to let you know I've done everything in my power to provide for the welfare and well being of the families of those souls lost on the islands.
All four people move closer to the TV as PERKINS turns the sound on.

I'm not asking you because I feel you owe me anything, quite the opposite, I am asking you to take this responsibility because you are the only three people in the world I know I can trust to make the right decisions.
IAN MALCOLM (smirking) Well, I don't usually let people slide for mistakes of this magnitude, but what the heck.
I was no longer a lunatic who had seen dinosaurs with a bunch of other people who didn't.
A young Army officer steps into the office.
JOHN HAMMOND (CONT'D) Before I leave you, I'd like to let you know I've done everything in my power to provide for the welfare and well being of the families of those souls lost on the islands.
ELLIE SATTLER You lost as much as we did on that island, we shouldn't have deserted you.
I've also set up a trust fund for the defense of the islands, Mr. Perkins will be able to provide you with all the necessary paperwork, and I've retained him as chief counsel for you.
JOHN HAMMOND (CONT'D) Before I leave you, I'd like to let you know I've done everything in my power to provide for the welfare and well being of the families of those souls lost on the islands.
I have long considered myself the steward of the islands and their inhabitants, but I will not be here forever.
Before the disaster on Isla Nublar, I thought of myself as the creator of a perfect system, a god of the island itself.
I had no intention of ever hurting anyone, but misfortune seemed to be the norm on the islands.
Dr. Grant, I want to apologize to you for burdening you with the safety of what amounted to three children on two separate islands.
ELLIE SATTLER You lost as much as we did on that island, we shouldn't have deserted you.
I hope you find a way to continue your excellent work in the field.
Dr. Sattler, I hope you can find it in your heart to forgive me for what happened in the park.
ALAN GRANT (CONT'D) (whispering to SATTLER) Ellie, go to Seattle and find Dr. Wang.
I know the years that followed the disaster weren't easy on you or your relationship with Dr. Grant.
MELINA ORTEGA Apparently the creature's roar brought many curious villagers out of their homes.
Thank you, Ian, for teaching me that there are some things Man cannot control.
Thank you, Ian, for teaching me that there are some things Man cannot control.
Thank you, Ian, for teaching me that there are some things Man cannot control.
Thank you, Ian, for teaching me that there are some things Man cannot control.
